unnormalised: ## Ditch the CDs, Dude! Music Streaming is Here to Stay (and Save Your Shelf Space)
normalised: ## Ditch the C D s, Dude! Music Streaming is Here to Stay (and Save Your Shelf Space)

unnormalised: Hey folks, remember those days of painstakingly creating mixtapes and hoarding CDs? Man, my shelf in my Mumbai flat used to groan under the weight of Lata Mangeshkar, AR Rahman soundtracks, and the random international albums I picked up at Rhythm House. Good times, good times. But honestly, good riddance too!

unnormalised: Because let's be real, music streaming has completely revolutionized how we listen to our favourite tunes. No more scratching CDs, no more rewinding cassettes with a pencil (okay, I’m *really* dating myself here!), and definitely no more lugging around a heavy Discman on the local train.

unnormalised: These days, all you need is your phone, an internet connection, and boom! Instant access to literally millions of songs. Services like Spotify, Apple Music, Gaana, and JioSaavn (to name a few!) offer incredible libraries that cater to every taste, from classical ragas to the latest Bollywood bangers.

unnormalised: Think about it - you can create personalized playlists for everything: workout sessions, romantic dinners (powered by Kishore Kumar, of course!), or even just chilling with a cup of chai on your balcony. You can discover new artists and genres you never even knew existed. I mean, I recently stumbled upon some amazing Carnatic fusion stuff and I'm completely hooked!

unnormalised: Plus, it's so much more affordable than buying individual albums. Most streaming services offer monthly subscriptions for around Rs. 99 (or even cheaper deals for students!), which is way less than buying just one new CD used to cost. Think of all the samosas you can buy with that saved money!

unnormalised: Even institutions like IIT Bombay are hosting virtual music festivals streamed online! It's truly incredible how technology has made music so accessible.

unnormalised: Of course, there's always the debate about artists getting fairly compensated (which is a valid concern!), but the convenience and sheer variety offered by music streaming are undeniable.
normalised: Of course, there's always the debate about artists getting fairly compensated (which is a valid concern!), but the convenience and sheer variety offered by music streaming are undeniable.

unnormalised: So next time you're craving some music, skip the physical stores and dive into the world of streaming. You might just find your new favourite song (or rediscover an old gem like that iconic track from "Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge"). Trust me, your shelf (and your ears) will thank you!
